describe: Uganda, known as the 'Pearl of Africa', is a landlocked country in East Africa. It is renowned for its diverse wildlife, including the rare mountain gorillas and the Big Five, as well as its stunning landscapes ranging from the snow-capped Rwenzori Mountains to the expansive Lake Victoria.

cities.name: üå≥ Kampala
cities.geographical_location: Located in the central region of Uganda, near the northern shores of Lake Victoria.
cities.climate: Kampala has a tropical rainforest climate with two rainy seasons, from March to May and September to November.
cities.famous_cuisine: Rolex (rolled chapati with eggs), Luwombo (stewed dish), and Matoke (steamed bananas).

cities.name: üèù Entebbe
cities.geographical_location: Situated on a Lake Victoria peninsula, approximately 37 kilometers southwest of Kampala.
cities.climate: Entebbe has a tropical rainforest climate with relatively consistent temperatures year-round.
cities.famous_cuisine: Fresh fish from Lake Victoria, Ugandan groundnut sauce, and Posho (maize porridge).

cities.name: üå≥ Jinja
cities.geographical_location: Located in the Eastern Region of Uganda, on the shores of Lake Victoria, near the source of the Nile River.
cities.climate: Jinja has a tropical rainforest climate with significant rainfall throughout the year.
cities.famous_cuisine: Tilapia fish, Ugandan chapati, and Mandazi (fried dough snack).
